job_title: Direct Support Professional (DSP) in New York, NY
pros: Decent company to work for. Staff is very helpful whenever I have had any questions or concerns about something work related.
cons: Pay can be better. I am looking into finding a second job to do overnight work. Hoping that I can find someone that would be open to hire for a pay rate that can be a good five dollar bump from what I make now. The do give mileage reimbursements and when making purchases during your shifts, but it is still not enough to stay financially stable.

review_title: Very fast response from the office team

review_title: Don’t be fooled about the AIM “family”
pros: Every position other than a DSP position pays quite well. There are some outstanding staff who truly care.
cons: Agency is run by a complete narcissist who cannot listen to any opinions that oppose his. He pretends to create a safe space where he can be questioned, but he eliminates anyone who challenges him. Culture is toxic unless you’re loved by the CEO and senior management. Is not actually client-focused although CEO brags constantly about AIM being so much better than other agencies.

pros: AIM is a very supportive and rewarding place to work.
cons: I have not experienced any cons per say.

job_title: Direct Support Professional in Saratoga Springs, NY
pros:
As a residential staff, your experience will differ based on the house manager. I have been lucky enough to have a great manager who cares about their staff and allows flexibility as needed. 
This is a very rewarding line of work, I have developed great friendships with the individuals I support. There are frustrating times, but overall I have loved the day to day of my work.
cons:
Very low pay, it is hard to make ends meet unless you work overtime or have a second income. 
You will frequently be asked to pick up extra shifts and very occasionally be mandated to stay late.

pros:
This agency is a wonderful place to work. We all have so much to learn and this is the very place to teach you how to support not only the wonderful people in this community but also simply how to support wo/mankind. The training is continuous because there is always more to learn. 
Everyone in this agency builds and creates a great team. 
Not only is this the most rewarding job I've ever had, it's also the most fun.
cons: You may have to step out of your comfort zone...but with the right communication you can get help/training wherever you feel you need it.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saratoga Springs, NY
pros:
Great atmosphere, it feels like a big family here! There's an open door policy and everyone is very supportive and willing to help you if you have a problem, or answer any questions. You can tell everyone that works here really cares about the people they serve. There's lots of opportunity for growth, and they support and encourage you to continue your career here.
Great benefits too... affordable health insurance (lots of discounts for non-smoking and attending other little events), eye care, dental, and retirement.
cons: At times it can be a really hard job, but it is definitely rewarding.

pros: You work with folks who help show you who you really are, and by giving them support you give yourself hope.
cons:
You have to deal with quite possibly the worst executive board imaginable. They pretend things aren’t a problem until their hands are forced and then it’s a you know what show. 

Little respect for staff, they will let certain individuals run right over you time and again with no support because hey bring in the big bucks from the state.

pros: Working with individuals with special needs
cons: They will somewhat train you. Then they threaten to withold pay when their computer system doesn't work properly
